io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x.explore

Class GameListQueryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x.explore.GameListQueryBuilder

  • public class GameListQueryBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to create a GameListQuery, combining the different filled search criteria into the target query. Internally, we build a big BooleanQuery, articulating clauses for all criteria.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_ELO
      Beyond this unreasonable value (5000), the query will not be built.

    • Constructor Summary

        public static final int MAX_ELO

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameListQueryBuilder

        public GameListQueryBuilder(org.apache.lucene.util.Version version,
                    org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer analyzer,
                    int analysisDepth)
        Parameters:
        version - The Lucene engine.
        analyzer - The analyzer used for indexing (to be used with a query parser).
        analysisDepth - The opening moves depth.

    • Method Detail

      • createQuery

        public org.apache.lucene.search.Query createQuery(java.lang.String white,
                                         java.lang.String black,
                                         int elo,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> moves)
        Creates the query, combining all parameters. Combinations are made with a boolean AND (Lucene's BooleanClause.Occur.MUST), empty values not being taken into account.
        Parameters:
        white - The name for White (case-insensitive). Many names can be specified, if separated by a comma. Exact match can be requested by enclosing the name within double quotes.
        black - The name for Black. Same rules as for the name for White.
        elo - The minimum elo.
        moves - The starting moves of the searched games. Will only consider moves up to the first null or empty entry in the list.
        Returns:
        A query to be executed against the index.
